document_data.name: Witch Doctor
document_data.mainbody: A '''witchdoctor''' was a rare distinct variation of [[shaman]], which combined the [[divine magic|divine]] abilities of shamanism with a limited use of [[wizard]]ly [[arcane magic]].{{Cite dragon/141/Orcs Throw Spells, Too!|24}}

Culture.Racial Practitioners:
Besides orcs,{{Cite dragon/141/Orcs Throw Spells, Too!|27}} [[fire troll]]s,{{Cite dragon/199/The Dragon's Bestiary: Those terrible trolls|199}} the various standard [[goblinoid]] races, [[gnoll]]s and [[flind]]s, [[orog]]s, and [[xvart]]s.

Witch doctors were extremely rare among [[giant]]s, [[fog giant]]s, and [[mountain giant]]s.This core source also mentions [[fomorian]]s and [[verbeeg]] as being capable of being witchdoctors. However, the Realms source ''[[Giantcraft]]'' says otherwise. And beyond humanoids, humans and neanderthals could be found practicing this tradition.
Culture.Practition by Region:
[[Orc]] communities that practiced this tradition could be found in [[the North]], the [[Thousand Fists]] tribe in the [[Nether Mountains]],{{Cite web/Mintiper's Chapbook/Part 10}} the [[Goblin Marches]], and the [[Storm Horns]]. Also in the North, the tribal humans known as [[Ice Hunter]]s practiced this tradition, with the most ancient of them having limited use of powerful ice, snow, and cold magics. In [[southwest Faerûn]], witch doctors could be found among tribes on the [[Chultan Peninsula]], where they often purchased mined materials from the local [[Chultan dwarves]].<ref>

Beyond [[Faerûn]], witch doctors could be found in parts of the continent of [[Kara-Tur]]. In [[T'u Lung]], witch doctors were [[T'u Lung language|locally referred to]] as '''kio ton mu''' and were typically members of cults,<ref> such as the [[Black Leopard Cult]]. On the [[Malatran Plateau]], witch doctors could be found in the tribes of the various races that inhabited it,{{Cite polyhedron/102/Heroes of Malatra|13}}{{Cite polyhedron/121/Living Jungle Character Generation|18}} but were rarer and more powerful compared to the Plateau's shamans.<ref>{{Cite polyhedron/108/Living Jungle Q&A|14}} The Plateau's [[shu]] tribes for example, those with five or more families typically had a witch doctor.{{Cite polyhedron/102/Malatra Monstrous Compendium Sheets|24}} And in the [[Southern Ocean]], witch doctors could be found among the [[Island Kingdoms]].

In the land of [[Zakhara]], the [[maskhi]] had male witch doctors that typically specialized in the arcane provinces of [[sand (province)|sand]] and [[wind (province)|wind]]. And beyond surface worlds, they could be found on goblinoid [[spelljammer]]s.
Culture.Practition by Faith:
In terms of religions, humanoid witch doctors could be found in service of evil-aligned [[demihuman]] or human deities,{{Cite dragon/141/Orcs Throw Spells, Too!|24}} such as [[Auril]]<ref> or [[Bhaal]] in the case of the orcs of the [[Trollmoors]]. Among the humanoid deities, witch doctors were in service of the [[Goblinoid pantheon]],

Much like [[warlock]]s, witch doctors could also be servitors of powerful non-deity entities. In terms of [[fiend]]s, witch doctors could be found in service of [[archdevil]]s, [[demon lord]]s,{{Cite dragon/141/Orcs Throw Spells, Too!|33}} and [[Yugoloth#Greater_Yugoloths|greater daemons]],

document_data.Possessions:
Much like a wizard, witch doctors never wore armor. The spellbooks carried by humanoid witch doctors were often crude and bulky tablets of poor-quality [[paper]] or wood. This was due to the difficulty of obtaining expensive [[parchment]], their inability to afford improving them, or lack of skill necessary to improve them.

Witch doctors often had [[magical item]]s, including [[cursed item|cursed ones]] like a ''[[necklace of strangulation]]'', and [[scroll]]s. They could even wield items that were usually restricted to wizards. Much like spells, a witch doctor liberally utilized their magical items in order to maintain their tribe's confidence in their power. Because of this, they often seized and hoarded all such suspected magical items brought into their tribe.
document_data.History:
Before the rise of [[Netheril]], witch doctors were among the few human spellcasters on [[Toril]].<ref>

In the {{YearlinkName|400}}, witch doctors of [[Gruumsh]] were among the orc forces in the [[Dark Alliance]] that assembled to assault [[Northkeep]].<ref> Orc witch doctors were a part of the [[Legion of the Chimera]] that besieged the [[Ten Towns]] of [[Icewind Dale]] in the {{YearlinkName|1312}}.
document_data.Notable Witch Doctors:
[[File:Bengoukee the Witch Doctor.jpg|thumb|''Bengoukee the Witch Doctor.'']]
* [[Bengoukee]], a nubari witch doctor and chief advisor of Chief [[Bagoomba]].<ref>{{Cite polyhedron/102/Tribes of the Nubari|9}}
* [[Intulik]]
* [[Kinondra]], a fire giant witch doctor that acted as a leader of such giants in the [[Deepwing Mountains]].
* [[Ras T'fima]]
* [[Redeye]]
